title: Aramco valuation set to come out as early as Friday
text:
The firm’s investment bankers are in the final stages of preparing their recommendations for the valuation of the world’s largest IPO. Aramco will first list shares on Saudi Arabia’s Tadawul exchange, with a second-stage international listing planned for the future. (Wall Street Journal)

Talking point: Valuation has been a major sticking point for the state-owned energy giant; the IPOwas formally halted in 2018 due to investor skepticism about Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman’s original US$2-trillion figure. Since then, oil prices have improved and the company revealed its closely guarded financial details to the public. But executives working on the IPO have maintained that US$1.5 trillion is a more realistic valuation. The final number is a balancing act—it has to be high enough to fulfill the crown prince’s ambitious economic diversification goals, but low enough to satisfy skeptical investors. Listing in two stages—first domestically, and then internationally—is one way to drive up that number, helping ensure demand exceeds supply.
